Node.definition: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= difficulties ≈ described as a river
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= process by the human body is affected by fire
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
= process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= a sum of money demanded or paid, either legally or illegally, in exchange for a service, or in exchange for someone's freedom or someone's life
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= ethnic group and their territory, ◄ regarded as descendants of Cush, son of Ham (חָם)
= ethnic group ◄ founded by Seba, son of Cush (כּוּשׁ) regarded as a descendant of Ham (חָם)
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= state in which humans are valuable and worthy of respect in the eyes of others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to be honorable|to be worthy of honor|to be renowned
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are regarded as worthy of honor and respect
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
literally: sunset; hence: = a cardinal direction indicating the direction towards the setting of the sun
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= area located to the south of a point of reference
literally: to confine (someone from doing something); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep (other) humans from engaging in a certain activity
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
literally: to know; hence: = action by which humans exercise their minds with regards to a certain matter so that they will know what to do
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= particle indicating that a certain state is not true or that an event does not take place without the involvement of someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which an object is considered as not belonging to a certain group of objects
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to (cause to) turn back|to cause to cease|to avert|to revoke
Node.definition: literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain condition in which they are not personally involved to come to an end

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire

Node.gloss: to lower|to let down|to take down|to bring down|to take off (ornaments)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to move from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
= state of deep sorrow and grief; ◄ caused by the death of a relative or friend or by other tragic circumstances
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which a person, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= a group of chariots (מֶרְכָּבָה) usually owned by one single person

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

= an organized military force equipped for fighting on land; this term denotes primarily the foot soldiers, though it can also be used to refer to the entire fighting force, including chariots and horsemen
= state in which humans or deities are able to perform powerful acts
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death
= a strip of cotton that, when placed in a lamp, draws up the oil on one side and is set alight on the other
= process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= state in which events have happened in the past from the point of view of the speaker

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= process by which a certain condition becomes a reality, ◄ as a new shoot that comes up from the ground
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= causative action by which deities call objects to existence
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= area without water and therefore without vegetation and settlers; sometimes taken as the name of one specific region
= flowing body of water
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
possibly shortened form of נֶפֶשׁ חַיָּה living creature: = animal; ◄ generic, sometimes referring to all animals, sometimes limited to wild land animals only

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

= animal looking like a longhaired dog with a pointed nose; yellowish brown in color with red tips to the fur on the back and a bushy tail; produces mournful sounds; ≈ used mainly in poetry and associated with death, destruction, and devastation, but also with mourning and weeping
see יַעְַנָה (יַעֲנָה)

exact meaning unknown; probably: = a type of owl, large, standing over 75 centimeters (30 inches) tall; it has a pale fawn color, is spotted, has ear tufts, and is best known by its loud, deep hooting at night; it roosts by day in deep shade in acacia trees, caves, tombs, and ruined buildings; it feeds on small mammals, including hares, baby gazelles, lambs, rats and mice, and large roosting birds, especially wild and domestic ducks; ◄ Bubo bubo; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= flowing body of water
= area without water and therefore without vegetation and settlers; sometimes taken as the name of one specific region
= individual or group of people especially selected and appointed for a certain purpose
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= male or female herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect

= causative action by which deities cause humans, either as individuals or as groups, to assume a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations
= a generic terms for an offering made to a deity

Node.gloss: to wear out|to demand work from
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to be engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

meaning unsure; either: (1) = type of grass that grows in clumps to more than a meter high and has stiff leaves like sword grass and has a sweet smell; ◄ Cymbopogon; ► oil is extracted by boiling and distilling the leaves; used in the oil for anointing priests; or (2) = a type of reed with stiff leaves, distinguished by its green flower head that grows on a stalk to about 50 cm high; ◄ Acorus calamus or Calamus; ► the scented leaves and more strongly scented tubers have traditionally been used medicinally and to make fragrances, and the dried and powdered tubers have been used as a substitute for ginger, cinnamon and nutmeg
= fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= particle marking a proposition as contrastive, and so limiting the scope or impact of what was stated before

= causative action by which deities cause humans, either as individuals or as groups, to assume a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to wear out|to demand work from
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to be engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which deities decide to no longer hold a certain human's behavior against that person, as if by erasing that sin from one's record
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= causative action by which humans cause a deity to process certain information
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior
= indirect male progenitor
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to act as a spokesman|to act as a mediator
Node.definition: to act as an intermediary for a party for communicating with another, physically or hierarchically remote, party
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
= causative action by which humans or deities bring dishonor on other humans
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

Node.gloss: something devoted to God|something devoted for destruction
Node.definition: = state of having been set irrevocably apart for God; ► as a result of which people and animals are to be put to death, cities are to be destroyed, and other objects are to be set apart for the service of God

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which a human being utters words that are intended to provoke shame in someone else
